TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: When I'm thinking I can make a trash can into a rocket
When you are wishing for radiator panels to manage your body heat.

When I spend 8 hours working on a plane design to land VTOL style on Mun, drill some ore into its tanks, fly back and land like an STS on Kerbin

except 8 hours later it don't friggin' work!
when you only say kerbal planet names.
When I'm glad steam can't track how many time I've played

Once, I woke up with crazy thoughts in my head like Ã¢â‚¬Å“I must attach some engines to my alarm-clock radially! Why canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t I do that?.. Ah, of course! The alarm-clock is already launched, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not in VAB so I cannot attach anything to it.Ã¢â‚¬Â

You know you play too much KSP when...

You compare a failed business to having not made orbit and burned back in to the atmosphere due to insufficient ÃŽâ€v
When you fail a mission by not having a few hundered m/s of Delta-V to swing by Eeloo.
When you actually create a boat mod.
When you come up against an issue and ending up dreaming about it that night and your dream gives you a workable solution.

On Deviantart I see a picture, "Zecora transfer" - project of a print to be transferred to a T-shirt.

And I immediately jump to the conclusion: Zecora developed a new orbital maneuver?!

...likely, for low-thrust engines that require many orbits to get there, and so they spiral their way up before departing in any desired direction. So... that's what her cutie mark means!

Edited July 7, 2015 by Sharpy

On Deviantart I see a picture, "Zecora transfer" - project of a print to be transferred to a T-shirt.

And I immediately jump to the conclusion: Zecora developed a new orbital maneuver?!

...likely, for low-thrust engines that require many orbits to get there, and so they spiral their way up. So... that's what her cutie mark shows!

Wait... What the... Hold on...

That makes too much sense! Was this all planned from the beginning?

Jeez. And I though I overthought things...

Edited July 7, 2015 by Xannari Ferrows

I opened this thread and there's enormous pony zebra picture at the top of the page... Really, forum, really...

Back on topic - when you see a sunset and thnik that you need to rotate the camera and make a screenshot...

Edited July 7, 2015 by Kuu Lightwing

When you come up against an issue and ending up dreaming about it that night and your dream gives you a workable solution.

Your subconscious is a genius!
You know you play KSP too much when you design a mun lander....in a dream.

You know you are too old to play KSP when you click on the VAB and think "Why did I come in here?"

(Sad but true. I only realised I wasn't in the SPH when I couldn't find the plane I was looking for in the list.)
When you can remember the planets of the Kerbal solar system by heart but you're a little fuzzy on the real ones . . .
When you look at any problem and you think to yourself, "What would Jeb do?"
Today I drove over a bridge, but the numerous patches, repairs and whatnot reminded me of the Level 2 Runway.

Thought about how buying lunch, rather than bringing it would save a considerable amount of space in my bag. My next thought: that's basically ISRU.

Haven't had much chance to play any KSP for a while now. I think it's starting to show...
When you call mars duna.
When you work in a grocery store and you see this and read it as "Kerbal Tea".

When you see a sci-fi or space movie where the pilot describes a maneuver as extremely dangerous, and you think he must be braindamaged because you can do that maneuver in your sleep, and even if you goof it up, it's a minor correction burn.

Ummmm, I think this picture of a mass exodus says it all...

JR

When I'm glad steam can't track how many time I've played

Steam shows how much time you played any game...

EDIT: Copies from the ksp site don't show that.

Edited August 7, 2015 by Thegamer211
